chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay restitution:  
to Claire N., in the stipulated amount of $1,125.00 and
to Mary S., in the amount of $84.88.
To be paid from 25% of prison funds with balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   
Additional restitution to be determined at a later date (restitution hearing set before BR 20 on 07-15-14 at 8:30 a.m.)

*******7-15-14 Judge Moroney, Court ordered additional $1680.00 in restitution to be paid to Claire N. from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance would be paid while on extended supervision. All other terms and conditions set forth at sentencing remain *****

Pay balances remaining of restitution, 
Pay DNA surcharge PLUS costs and disbursements. 
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.

As a convicted felon, defendant may not possess any firearms or body armor.  
Defendnt advised of voting ineligibilty

NO CONTACT with Claire N., Julie S., or Mary S.  
NO alcohol.  
NO controlled substances.

Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.  
Anger Manangement.  
Parenting counseling/ classes.
Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.

AODA assessment and treatment. 
Urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Received from court this day, Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order, faxed to:  (715) 246-3680, and mailed to:  Superintendent Skalski, St. Croix Correctional Center, PO Box 36, New Richmond, WI  54017-0036.  jm

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - CIP, signed, filed, and distributed.
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 20, Judge Wall.  jm

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (39 pages) commencing JUNE 17, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks not in court, defendant in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Petitioner June Harper-Cheeks appeared in person, pro se.  Return of property hearing continues.  State advised the Court that the liason detective was unable to operate/verify ownership of phone, as the serial number was scratched off and a passcode was needed.  Petitioner unable to provide passcode.  Based upon lack of information for verification, Court denied petition for return of property.

Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks not in court, defendant in custody.  Petitioner for property release is Mrs. June Harper-Cheeks.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return of property hearing proceeds.  State requested another date to determine owner of cellphone based upon petitioner's production of records.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on property hearing.  Return of property hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Return of property hearing on September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
MPD Inventory #14004264.

Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in court with attorney Reyna Morales for attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in custody and appeared by video.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morales had colloquy with defendant out of the presence of the State and court.  Defendant did not object to additional amount of restitution requested and would stipulate.  Restitution hearing proceeded.  Received and filed: billing information/documentation from Claire N.  Court ordered additional $1,680.00 in restitution to be paid to Claire N. from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance would be paid while on extended supervision.  All other terms and conditions set forth at sentencing remain.
/from Progressive Insurance, received.

/and Restitution Worksheet (Claire N.), received and filed;
/and Restitution Worksheet (Julie S.), received and filed.
/(4), in support of defendant, filed. rn
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.

Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed, charging the defendant with the following:
COUNT 01:
Same
COUNT 02:
Robbery (Threat of Force) as a Party to a Crime, a Class E Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. sections 943.32(1)(b) and 939.05.
COUNT 3:
Same.

Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court, defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint request for brief adjournment was granted and approved by the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court, defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript (18 pages) commencing on 03-14-2014 PRELIMINARY AND ARRAIGNMENT received and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective Gena Malanche.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and entered pleas of not guilty.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 20.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests an adjournment, officer is not able to appear for today's proceedings.  Defense does not object.    Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Claire N.; Mary S. or Julie S.

Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Leroy Meshawn Cheeks in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defense moves to dismiss Count 2 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss Count 2.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
